source.f31b1d0c:
df_analysis = df[['Time from Start to Finish (seconds)', 'Q1']]
df['Time from Start to Finish (seconds)'] = df['Time from Start to Finish (seconds)'].astype('int64') 
df['Q1'] = df['Q1'].astype('str') 
df_age_timespent_avg = df.groupby('Q1')['Time from Start to Finish (seconds)'].mean()
df_age_timespent_std = df.groupby('Q1')['Time from Start to Finish (seconds)'].std()
source.fb20e0db:
age_grp = df_age_timespent_avg.index
x_pos = np.arange(len(age_grp))
mn = df_age_timespent_avg.values
std = df_age_timespent_std.values
source.52610357:
fig, ax = plt.subplots()
ax.bar(x_pos, mn, yerr=std, align='center', alpha=0.5, ecolor='black', capsize=10)
ax.set_ylabel('Time from Start to finish')
ax.set_xticks(x_pos)
ax.set_xticklabels(age_grp)
ax.set_title('Time taken vs Group with Std')
ax.yaxis.grid(True)

source.cbc865bb: # People get young as they grow old
source.6a8572e7: It is a old saying that when people gets old, they start behaving like a child. And that is what I found from these Survey dataset. Let's pull in the data first:
source.1546f518: **Extracting out the questions from the dataset**
source.d5c5c3b4:
From the graph right above (Time taken to finish the Survey for each group) what we can say that the average time taken by the oldest in age (and the most experienced with life) Kagglers is nearest to the time taken by the youngest Kagglers. And time taken represents how focused and quick these Kagglers were and hence we can say - Kagglers get young as they grow old.

Let's explore some takeaways from this small analysis:
* The high time taken group is 55-69 yrs and they also had a vast variation as well. We can say that they have better things to do than Kaggling (Just kidding)
* The 50-54 group really stands out in respect to time taken. They break the increasing trend. This Gen X stands out. Kudos 50-54 group, you guys are the Outliers, you will be treated Specially ;)
* The 22-44 yrs group, the biggest chunk of the Kaggler community, are the most predictable group. They follow a trend simple enough to be predicted by a simple linear regression. I personally like it, since I belong in this group :)
* 18-21 years group - really proud of this upcoming Gen Z Kagglers !!
